data.title: "Run Python file in terminal" fails with error
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 7 Professional SP1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a Python file with the single line ```print("Hello, world")```
2. Right click on the file and select "Run Python file in terminal"

The following output appears in the terminal window:

```
Windows PowerShell
Copyright (C) 2015 Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

PS 13:57 C:\Work\Scratch\test
>"C:/Windows/py.exe" c:/Work/Scratch/test/__main__.py
At line:1 char:21
+ "C:/Windows/py.exe" c:/Work/Scratch/test/__main__.py
+                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Unexpected token 'c:/Work/Scratch/test/__main__.py' in expression or statement.
    + CategoryInfo          : ParserError: (:) [], ParentContainsErrorRecordException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : UnexpectedToken

PS 13:57 {00:00.007} C:\Work\Scratch\test
>
```

It's not clear to me whether this action comes from VS Code itself or from an extension (I have the "Python" and "Powershell" extensions installed). But it does seem that the action is failing to format the shell command in a way that Powershell can execute (an initial ```&``` is needed as the executable name is quoted).

My settings file includes the following:

```json
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{
  // Customizes which terminal to run on Windows.
  "terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\WINDOWS\\sysnative\\WindowsPowerShell\\v1.0\\powershell.exe",
  //"python.pythonPath": "C:\\Users\\UK03306\\AppData\\Local\\Programs\\Python\\Python36\\python.exe"
  "python.pythonPath": "C:\\Windows\\py.exe"
}
```

I'm guessing that the "Run Python file in terminal" command isn't taking into account the possibility that the default shell is not ```cmd.exe```. Removing my custom ```terminal.integrated.shell.windows``` allows "Run Python file..." to work, but I do *not* consider that to be an acceptable solution here, as it would affect the behaviour of ```Ctrl-Shift-'``` (Create New Integrated Terminal).

data.title: [win] Mocha test runner doesn't work when there is a space in the path
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 10/8/7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a project with path that contains spaces
2. Add "mocha test" debug configuration

My path is c:\Users\aharon\Documents\Visual Studio 2013\Projects\mrs\mrs

I get 'c:\Users\aharon\Documents\Visual' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.'

The path to exec need to be surrounded by " ", 
but when I try to do that it complains about something else.

When running operations that can take a long time, like searching into files, if the user clicks outside the VSCode window to do something else, the search is interrupted.

Suggestion: have an option to not interrupt actions if the VSCode's window loses focus.

data.title: Feature request: different settings for split-view windows
data.body:
I would like to able to change the settings of one of the views when using split-view.
I wanted to toggle the word-wrap option for one of the views, but the option changes all the views.
It would be comfortable to have the option for both views, but as well as on the currently focused view.
And it would be good if more features are integrated the same way.

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce: 

1. Open some code file
2. Split the editor and open the documentation or specification for that source code
3. Toggle the view for the Documentation to be "WordWrap:ON"
and for the source code to be "WordWrap:OFF"

Expected: the option should be in different state for the views

Current result: We have all the views in the same state for the WordWrap option.

data.title: Keyboard shortcut for Next / Previous Change in diff view
data.body: In the diff (compare) view, e.g., after clicking on a changed file in the Git sidebar, it would be useful to have keyboard shortcuts for Next Change / Previous Change actions. Those are currently just clickable arrow in the top right.

data.title: git refresh with big latency
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:31:00.827Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.5|
|code-runner|formulahendry|0.6.8|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.7.3|
|vscode-hexdump|slevesque|1.1.4|
|gitblame|waderyan|1.3.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. setup "git.autorefresh": false, "git.autofetch": false, 
2. open git panel
3. press "Refresh" button

Expected: immediately refresh process with progress line animation.

Actual: refresh process with progress line animation only after 5 seconds. But in task manager some service in services group take 100% immediately.

data.title: Intelisense not available in Java projects.. Taking forever "Starting Java Language Server"
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- 1.9.0
- Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

I'm using the extension "Language Support for Java by RedHat".

1. Open a folder housing several reasonably large java projects.
      c:\git-repos\
                         \repo1
                         \repo2
                         \repo3
                         ....
    Not all repositories are java but the the majority are.
2. Open a java source file from one of the projects (c:\git-repos\repo1\src\main\java\com\...\SomeJavaFile.Java) and look at the intelisense for anything.

"Loading..." will appear in the tooltip and the status bar you will see "Starting Java Language Server..." I've waited over 30 minutes and still see this with no intelisense available. The projects are not insanely huge. This has worked on a tiny test project outside the folder containing lots of java project repositories,

data.title: Undo (Ctrl+Z) when doing search-replace from the search window GUI does not work
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af)
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04, Gnome Shell

When searching and replacing text from the search window, doing undo (Ctrl+Z) does not undo the text in the editor.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Search for a text using Ctrl+F, enter a search text and a replacement text
2. Find the next occurrence with the "Next match" button, press the "Replace" button.
3. Press Ctrl+Z and see that the undo function did not undo the last replace in the text editor, but rather changed the typed text in the replacement field.

As a workaround, change the focus to the text buffer window, and then press undo.

data.title: Rejecting in Promise.race will trigger debug pause
Provide a command to toggle menu bar visibility without settings change
data.body:
by default, I set the menu bar to hidden.

Sometimes I need to show the menu bar, so I run the command "toggle menu bar", but when I want to return to the default hidden behaviour I'm forced to open my user settings.

It should be nice to have a command "hide menu bar" or having a unique command which respects toggle/hide behaviour

data.title: ${Env.<envvar>} not getting expanded in PowerShell debug configuration
data.body:
_From @rkeithhill on February 6, 2017 5:25_

This [page](http://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/debugging) says:

> You can also reference environment variables through ${env.Name} syntax (e.g. ${env.PATH}). Be sure to match the environment variable name's casing, for example ${env.Path} on Windows.

Yet I'm finding with our PowerShell extension, no value gets passed to the PowerShell debugger for the specified environment variable.  Is there something we need to do in the extension e.g. call an env var expansion API to make this work?

_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node#99_

data.title: February Iteration Plan
data.body:
This plan captures what we work on during February. We will ship **early March**.

Not unusual and still noteworthy: We will do several explorations that might or might not result in concrete deliverables in this or later releases.

The endgame for this iteration is tracked in #20981.

## Plan Items

Below is a summary of the top level plan items.

Legend for annotations:

| Mark  | Description |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| :runner: | work in progress  |
| :hand: | blocked task |
| :muscle: | stretch goal for this iteration  |
| :large_blue_circle: | more details required |
| :red_circle: | missing issue reference |

### Workbench
- [x] Evolve welcome experience and react to feedback @chrmarti 
- [x] Keybindings for explorer to enable VIM style navigation @bpasero
- [x] Render chording short cuts in the menus @bpasero
- Tasks
  - [x] Provide additional terminal APIs and functionality #15179 #12000 #18454 @Tyriar
  - [x] Define v2 of `task.json`, v2 shows the task output in the terminal  @dbaeumer
  - [x] Support to assign keybindings to tasks @dbaeumer 
- [x] Search: Explore search implementation based on [Silver Searcher](https://github.com/ggreer/the_silver_searcher) #19983 @roblourens
- [x] Move the preferences for theme, icon theme from local storage to settings #7358 @aeschli @sandy081
- [x] Linux auto update/auto signing #229 #2973 @Tyriar 

### Editor
- [x] Initial version of Minimap support #4865 @alexandrudima
- [x] Add ability to copy formatted code to clipboard #3518 @rebornix
- [x] Support to drag and drop selected text #1046 @rebornix 


### Languages
- C#
  - [x] Bundle the C# TextMate grammar https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19469 @aeschli
- TypeScript/JavaScript
  - [x] TS 2.2 adoption #20162 @mjbvz
  - [x] More `tsconfig.json` validation  (see also Microsoft/TypeScript#12336) #20163
  - [x] Explore improved language support for JSDoc comments #20161 @mjbvz
  - [x] Transfer tmGrammar ownership #20160 @mjbvz @aeschli
- HTML
  - [x] Analyze Live preview options @waderyan

### Debugging
- [x] Evolve `node2` and `node` into a single node debugging experience #19650 @weinand @roblourens 
- [x] Column break points #14784 @isidorn @weinand 
- [x] Improve the UI when an exception is thrown #16860@isidorn @michelkaporin 
- [x] DAP: Support for getting information about a thrown exception Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node#97 @weinand
- [x] Ability to select a launch configuration and start a debug target using keyboard #16613 @isidorn @michelkaporin 
- [x] Exploration: Live Edit #6930 @weinand @roblourens
- [x] Exploration: Async Stackframes #5552 @roblourens @weinand 

### Extension Authoring
- [x] Initial version of Source Control Provider API (API will still be in proposed state end of February) #15894 @joaomoreno
- [x] API to show a modal confirmation (required for SCM API) @joaomoreno 
- [x] Support that an extension can contribute and define its default language settings #19733 @sandy081


### Contributions to Extensions
- [ ] :running_man: php parser completion and investigate contribution @mousetraps
- [x] Go - support single file debugging without a launch config and add configuration snippets @ramya-rao-a
- [x] Docker  update [dockerfile_lint](https://github.com/projectatomic/dockerfile_lint) version @chrisdias
- [x] Docker  support running windows containers @chrisdias @lostintangent 
- [x] Docker  support running Azure CLI in a container @chrisdias

### Engineering Items
- [x] Investigate into next Electron update @bpasero
- [x] Performance test infrastructure for start-up performance @jrieken
- [x] Adopt @ types in our bundled extensions #20164 @mjbvz 
- [x] Start website for tools that help us managing issues and releases @sandy081 
- [ ] :running_man: Consolidate telemetry infrastructure @ramya-rao-a

### Deferred
- Investigate into implementing 'multi root workspaces', 'multi folder' workspaces @bpasero
- Additional theming options in the workbench (colors, fonts) #3112 @aeschli @bpasero
- Investigate more types for CompletionItemKind enum #2628 @jrieken
- Startup performance: provide a dashboard @jrieken, @seanmcbreen
- Exploration: configuration UI for exception hierarchies #18093 @weinand
- :hand: Support large extension, adopt new marketplace support #18146 @joaomoreno
- :hand: Adopt cancellation token support #18053 @mjbvz 
----
- Keyboard layout improvements #17521 @alexandrudima
- Support to contribute to task creation (template) and to contribute problem matchers @dbaeumer 
- Go - debug Intellisense support in the Debug Console @ramya-rao-a
- Move lines up/down with auto indent @rebornix
- Go - Support to run without a debugger attached @ramya-rao-a

data.title: CSS auto complete not work
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  sometimes css auto complete not work for me
